page.title: 01Stonegate-A Wealden Village
page.content: The small village of Stonegate is situated about nine miles south-east of Tunbridge Wells,occupying a ridge between the valleys of the rivers Rother and Lymden. The geology of the area consists of clay and sandstone,with some of this stone being used,in the past,for building. The land is mainly used for agriculture,with a mixture of arable,cattle,sheep and hop farming. There is no bus service to the village,the nearest route being about four kilometres away on the main Wadhurst-Ticehurst road. The railway station,about one kilometre from the village,is on the main line between Hastings and London,but the service from Stonegate is infrequent outside the "rush-hour."
